intro: Crinitaria, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, often blue or purple flowers. Crinitaria species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions. Their ecological importance includes stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
